be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.splitting.split

Class ContinuousBinarySplit

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.splitting.split.UnivariateSplit
      • be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.splitting.split.ContinuousBinarySplit

  • public class ContinuousBinarySplit
extends UnivariateSplit
    An instance of this class contains the splitting information to separate instances into two child nodes based on a threshold on a continuous variable (like CART trees)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ContinuousBinarySplit(int var, double index, double t)
      Initializes a binary split on the continuous variable var based on threshold t.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContinuousBinarySplit

        public ContinuousBinarySplit(int var,
                     double index,
                     double t)
        Initializes a binary split on the continuous variable var based on threshold t.
        Parameters:
        var - the column index of the variable in the full dataset
        index - the value of the metric optimized by the split (e.g. Gini)
        t - the threshold value on var. The two child nodes respectively contain instances with x[var] < t and x[var] >= t.

        Computes in which child node an instance falls into

        the index in [0 ; this.getNbChildren()[ of the child in which the training sample falls into
